results.title: Approach
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Salesmanship”.
A training film which stresses the importance of a well planned sales interview. Some of the factors that contribute to a good approach in selling are discussed. Stresses that a sales person must gain the interest, confidence, favourable attention, and positive interest of the prospective customer during the interview.

results.title: The Lost 600
results.creator_credit: Michael Robertson, New South Wales. Dept. of Sport and Recreation and Michael Robertson Film Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Safety in, on and near the water”.
Emphasises the dangers associated with foolish, unsafe and reckless behaviour in and on the water. Among the many aspects of water safety covered are still-water drownings, surf safety, boating, yachting, water skiing, rock fishing and home pools.

Understanding hazards & risks = Understanding hazards and risks

results.title: Understanding hazards & risks = Understanding hazards and risks
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Safetycare”
How we react to hazards in the workplace is a reflection on how we react to hazards as individuals and should not be underestimated in the success or failure of a safe work site. Providing clear definitions and differences between hazards and risks, this instructional video breaks down hazards into four categories: physical, chemical, biological and ergonomic. Examples in the workplace are provided, as are road rules and vehicle safety as indicative of successful reactive responses to risk. A trainer’s manual accompanies the tape.

results.title: Tools and Equipment
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Safetycare”.
Selecting the correct tool for the task, inspecting the tool for damage before use, using the tool in the correct way and storing and carrying tools safely may all seem fairly obvious. These four basic rules for safe use of tools are straightforward but are often abused. This video looks at each of the basic rules and it also examines the safe use of ladders.

results.title: Stop It Burning
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Safetycare”.
Portable fire extinguishers are the frontline of defence for most fires in the workplace. A knowledge of what types of fire extinguishers to use on what fires is important for everyone. This video looks at the extinguishing agents, shows the correct procedure for checking an extinguisher and details the differences in the application and methods of using the different types of extinguishers.

results.title: Slips,Trips and Falls
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Safetycare”.
Along with manual handling, slips, trips, and falls are the cause of a majority of accidents in the workplace. This video covers everything from the ground up…leads on the floors, objects such as books and briefcases, slippery surfaces through to filing cabinets and reaching too far, taking short cuts and general good housekeeping practices.

results.title: Portable fire extinguishers
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Safetycare”.
Looks at firefighting techniques of starvation, smothering, cooling and stopping the chemical chain reaction; extinguishing agents such as water, foam, carbon dioxide and dry powder; fire extinguishers for ordinary combustibles, flammable and combustible liquids, flammable gases, combustible metals, electrically energised equipment and cooking oils & fats; classifications of fires and the operation of fire extinguishers. The main aim of this package is to provide the facilitator with discussion points important to the overall development of the program and to allow participants the opportunity of discussing the impact the program may have on current work practices and whether in fact changes may be required. Included is a Trainer’s Manual.
